intro: Gentiana lacinulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Gentiana lacinulata is part of the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue flowers. It is often found in alpine meadows and woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
